---
title: "A Test of SASmarkdown"
author: "Ken Kleinman"
date: "May 19, 2017"
output: html_document
---

## In a first code chunk set up with
```{r}
require(SASmarkdown)
sashtmlengine()
saslogengine()
engine_output <- sasengine_output()

sasexe <- "D:/SASHome/SASFoundation/9.4/sas.exe"
sasopts <- "-nosplash -ls 75"

```
## Then set up SAS code chunks with
```{r example1, engine="sas", engine.path=sasexe, engine.opts=sasopts, comment=""}
proc means data=sashelp.class (keep = age);
run;
```
## Rerun with html output
```{r example2, engine="sashtml", engine.path=sasexe, engine.opts=sasopts, comment="", echo=FALSE}
proc means data=sashelp.class (keep = age);
run;
```
## Run an html example with graphics
```{r example3, engine="sashtml", engine.path=sasexe, engine.opts=sasopts, comment="", results="asis"}
proc corr data=sashelp.class nosimple plots=matrix;
run;
```
## And finally a log example
```{r example4, engine="saslog", engine.path=sasexe, engine.opts=sasopts, comment=""}
proc means data=sashelp.class (keep = age);
run;
```
